pros: I really loved working here. The other teachers and higher ups were very nice and even though it’s a corporate organization I still get like they cared about me and recognized my contributions to the team. The pay at the time as great comparable with what I’ve ever been payed as a hair stylist and they have great work schedules for the teachers at the Institute. If I were still in the industry I would be back working here in a second, I only left because Covid came and schools shut down.
cons: I honestly don’t have any complaints this was a great place to work for me.

pros: Good education, hands on experience, make new friends
cons: Cost of tuition, full time schedule

pros: Students are creative and fun, Great products, Fashion shows, Product Discounts, Creative team
cons: Management, Doing more work than is required in job description, Standing for long periods of time

job_title: Retail Sales Associate in Columbus, OH
pros: The most amazing group of people who truly do everything they can for each other and their students!
cons: They under pay staff then say "if you're here for the money then you're not here for the right reason" excuse, had the instructors manager tell us "there is the door" if you think you do not get paid enough in a company meeting before but the owner is a lawyer who has no real love for the industry and it shows, so its okay for the owner to be money hungry but you better not be because then you're there for the wrong reason!!!! And do not expect to get anywhere with corporate, because that is a giant brick wall!!!! Another issue I had was training. You shouldn't expect any!!! You will be trained on the job and then let to do your own thing until you make a mistake. This place is so easy to get trapped in because you fall in love with the people and the culture within the building but do not be fooled, that is not the company culture. this is just another toxic corporate company that over uses the word "family" so they can cross over boundary lines easier.

job_title: Admissions Representative in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great coworkers and location, easy to commute
cons: Schedule was difficult, micromanaged a lot unachievable goals

pros: Great product and steady student enrollment
cons: Walking on eggshells, HR is onsite and biased

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Dallas, TX
pros: The school is closed on Sundays
cons: Get everything in writing, you WILL be taken advantage of. Don’t spread yourself thin for these people, they couldn’t care less. They will just throw a pizza party whenever everyone is unhappy with how they are being treated.

job_title: Guest Coordinator in Los Angeles, CA
pros: 50% product discount and employee appreciation orders once a month where you get product almost 80% off.
cons: Abusive environment & disconnect between on site location and the support center in Ohio. Several staff members wrote up indecent reports about one particular person and nothing was done. Leading all of the staff in guest services to quit. Super high turn over rate of educators as well. About 10 people quit in a 2 month span.

pros: Great opportunity so try it out.
cons: Try it out and see

job_title: Retail Advisor in Winter Park, FL
pros: Discount on products and services
cons: This role includes the roles of education, admissions, management, and so much more. However, there is no compensation for doing these tasks. We “run the school” but are treated like less than the other employees. Management is never around and when situations occur that require them to intervene you are told to “say you’re the manager” and deal with it yourself even if you are new.

review_title: It was alright for a first career job
job_title: Financial Aid Manager in Atlanta, GA
pros: Manageable and consistent schedule. No weekends. You set your own appts depending on experience level.
cons: Shifty leadership. No overtime despite being hourly and being available around the clock. Minimum career movement based on availability within the company.

pros: Vegan , employee discount, supportive leadership and plenty of opportunity to grow
cons: One position..many roles. This is something I actually really enjoy but if you’re expecting just to check people in and out this job is not for you.

pros: discounts on products and services
cons: students can be a lot to handle

review_title: I’m in school for cosmetology and love it!
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Lafayette, LA
pros: The atmosphere is professional and amazing
cons: Giving up Saturdays for school

pros: Decent pay and free lunch here and there. Did give me the opportunity to learn helpful management skills.
cons: Always felt like I was walking on eggshells. You’re only as good as the last thing you did. Doesn’t matter how hard you work beyond your role. Very passive aggressive and petty. Atmosphere is extremely hostile and phony. Turnover rate is very high.

pros: Fun, laid back, get to help others and be around like-minded individuals
cons: Pay starts very low, too many stupid rules

pros: 4 days a week, with 3 days off!
cons: Long hours, maybe not ideal for person with small children

pros: I was able to work independently when necessary and I appreciated the lack of helicopter management
cons: The management team and owners were sometimes disorganized and certain people on the team I worked with were very very rude. This contributed to me quitting.

pros:
-Fun & engaging atmosphere
-Great coworkers
-Great company owner
-Invests in personal and professional growth
-Low stress
-Teaching students about hair and makeup is fun!
-Great repeat clientele
-Aveda product discounts
-Free advanced training classes with some really big name hair dressers

I've worked for this company for many years, and spent the majority of my professional life in an educational setting such as this.  I have honestly never enjoyed a job as much as I have enjoyed this one. Through out my time here I've been able to grow so much and I truly believe it is because management and the owner have their eye on exactly the right thing. The Students. The students make everything worth it and being able to educate them and work closely with them and their clients is truly magical to watch. Education can be a really stressful and challenging job if you let it be, but I can honestly say that at this school you are set up to succeed. The "high turn over" is a trend in this industry and through out my time here the ones that have come and gone, have left for various reasons but I absolutely wouldn't say its because of anything the company is doing. Education is just not the right fit for everyone. We have an amazing staff and a great student body!
cons: This industry does tend attract a more catty and dramatic type of person. Those people tend to act impulsively and may not understand how their actions or words can make a bad reputation for a company that I have loved working for.

pros: Fun team, fun students and fun events
cons: Schedule, pay, support, organization and uppermanagement

job_title: Cosmetology Educator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Passionate students, decent-ish benefits, product discounts
cons: No structure, no training, no paid sick days, abusive CEO, no safety plans or protocols, high turnover, perpetually understaffed, necessary supplies rarely on hand

pros: Nice students, 4 days a week, flexibility schedule wise. You're always able to swap days if you need to take time off. Overall a rewarding job if you're able to look past the BS
cons: Lack of trust and respect amongst co workers. Cattyness, competitive, favoritism. Lack of organization with team leads and lack of communication. The pay isn't good. They tell everyone they start at 35k BEFORE taxes which is about 28k. Barely a living wage for how expensive Colorado is. But honestly they don't care and if you ask for a raise they'll tell you that maybe you should get a second job if you can't afford living here. Which sucks because in my book, if you have established yourself in a career you shouldn't be scraping by when AVEDA makes billions of dollars a year. I feel there is greed with the CEO. It's hard when you look at the numbers the school is making.. (usually about $5,000-$6,000 a day in services and product sales) and I make a fraction of that per month. Not to mention the $20,000 he gets per student (about 280 students) But I don't get paid overtime, there are mandatory meetings all the time on your days off and you are expected to dedicate your life to this company when they don't do much for you in return.

job_title: Educator & Certified Aveda Color Coach in San Francisco, CA
pros:
I really enjoy the support that I receive from all of my colleagues. From fellow educators, our team leads and administrative staff, I always feel like I have the tools available to provide our students with the best cosmetology education possible. 
The director and president are both amazingly ambitious and caring women that constantly inspire me to be a better educator and they both encourage me to seek out new certifications and provide in-house continuing education for our instructional staff. 
I also feel challenged by the expectation to be a self-starter. If I feel as if I have a new idea that would benefit one of my classes, I am encouraged to try it and give feedback on the effectiveness of the new idea. 
We are working towards being a paperless institute and I love our commitment to the environment through our use of technology. 
Overall, I couldn't be happier with my decision to work for Cinta & the Aveda network and I hope I get the chance to do so for many years.
cons:
The days are long, but the reward of being able to invest in these future hairdressers definitely outweighs the 10-11 hour daily commitment. Having the flexibility of only working 3-4 days full time also makes the long days a good trade-off. 
Unlike most salon atmospheres, Cinta offers a benefits package after 90 days. 
Honestly, the educators are giving the same commitment as the students. I feel that is very fair.

pros: close to subway , great products
cons: pay was terrible, management put instructors against each other, allowed discrimination, not enough supplies

pros: Some people really care about the company's mission to give to the community.
cons: Not much training and always improvising.

pros: work with students going in to this field
cons: under paid for the amount of hours

pros: You interact with a lot of people leaving to some wonderful experiences. Being part of someone's educational experience and watching them grow. The company's culture and atmosphere is overall very positive and supportive. Room to advance and usually aims to promote within.
cons: Very stressful environment. Lack of support from higher-ups. The owner of inspire greatness institutes talks a good talk but is never involved. While working for the company the two times the owner was around it couldn't even get a hello in return. Urgent matters within departments are never resolved in a timely manner.  The Institute wants leadership to be involved consistently leaving no time to disconnect from work. Policies are implemented inconsistently. Rate of pay is extremely low for the amount of work involved. You do not feel you have a voice management to management. Individuals are pushed into the programs, employment is blamed for students who drop the program, goals are set higher than the average leaving to never reaching bonuses in any department. Aveda as a company is beautiful, inspire greatness Aveda institutes are just money hungry.

job_title: Experience Center Advisor in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
This is honestly one of the friendliest and supportive work environments I have ever been in. The camaraderie among co-workers is incredibly supportive and caring. Though the job can be stressful at times, you have a huge network of support and everyone does what they can to help each other out. You really get the chance to see the good in people every single day, and you have multiple opportunities to make the day brighter for many people.

The discount is great which helps make up a little for the lack of raises. The starting pay is agreeable especially for the type of work you'll be doing.
cons:
Yearly raises are very minimal, the job can seem tedious and monotonous at times, and the hour long lunch breaks are nice, but can make for some pretty long days.

You do tend to get the heat from any negativity in the building including disgruntled guests, but hey, it's good experience in learning how to deal with those situations and makes you a stronger and more well-rounded individual.

pros:
Great pay
Great benefits
3 consecutive days off
cons:
Long Hours
Schedule not as flexible

pros: Helping students achieve their dream
cons: Long hours schedule change lots of energy

pros: Great place to come work
cons: No cons at this time

pros: Help people on their journey to success
cons: Really rough leadership that doesn't prioritize employees

pros: Some of the students are great.  The regular clientele are enjoyable.  Health insurance and other benefits are good. Some co workers are great as well.
cons: This place gives new meaning to the phrase "overworked and underpaid ".  As a patron and alumni of Aveda it actually hurts me to be writing this.  The hours are horrible and the work load is even crazier and is constantly increasing mainly because they can't retain staff.  The current leadership is a micro manager and does nothing to help. They are very inconsistent and never give recognition. Within the last year they have taken away a week of vacation from there employees and also paid  everyone for time lost during the hurricane then after the fact told them it was an advance and had to be paid back.   Don't even get me started on the students that are required to take client's for almost 11hrs a day with little to no break because they are booked with clients so heavy and expected to do there clients as quick or quicker than in a regular salon.  I knew this place was not ideal before I got there but decided to give it a shot. I should have gone with my gut and never applied for the job.

review_title: I used to work for aveda institute in Corpus Christi , TX. As guest service I was always up at the front desk.
job_title: Guest Sercive in Corpus Christi, TX
pros: The pay was good and also the hours. The good thing was you got out early at 9pm unlike most other places. I was always working allot. There is allot of good potential to working there. Don't have any problems with anyone. This company you can move up in but most likely take a while because their very demanding.
cons: I was asking only for 2 of the evenings off Tuesdays and Wednesdays. For church but the management made it seem like it was unimportant for me to attend my church. Also I only called in once and  they hold it against  me. Due to a family emergency.  Point blank is they don't care about the employees even if you have proof for a written note from the hospital. They don't care even if is a life threatening situation or not. Its bad place to work for.

review_title: Bottom line, they think you're disposable
pros: Great school to attend because of the Aveda Name, Director of education is inspiring. Aveda mission is great, and some employees really care about their impact on others.
cons: No matter how much you give them they will get rid of you or push you out. Gossip is high, students treat you like you work for them and talk down to you, and will even yell and scream at you. No compensation for parking or any deals $8, $12, sometimes $20 a day for parking is insane. Weather delays seem like they have picked up but there were times I had to drive to work in extreme conditions risking my life for a place of work that in the end didn't value my care for the school. Owner of the institutes isn't very involved and doesn't get to know his employees personally. Just because you walk around from time to time and smile doesn't mean you really care for the individuals you employ. Overall, the pay was not worth the time spent away from my family, and the way I was treated by upper management and students was ridiculous.

pros: Decent benefits. Maternity leave was disability leave half pay is better than nothing
cons: NO time for kids. NO work life balance. Impossible job to do if you want or have a family. NO raises unless you participate in non paid charitable events.

job_title: Administrative Office Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Free salon services for employees. 
Discount on Aveda products.
Discount of Cinta Salon services.
If you're in management then services at both Cinta Salon and Cinta Aveda Institute are free.
cons:
Negative and hostile work environment; very catty.
Leadership micromanages and gossips about everyone including students.
Lack of organization; messy and lack of structure, protocols.
The management doesn't want to invest in employee retention.
Management will backstab employees to make themselves look competent.
They don't serve free coffee or tea but expect all employees to be energetic and productive.
They don't care at all about employee turnover because anyone is replaceable, and they treat employees as such. Extremely low morale and everyone is watching their backs.
Leaders actually yell at employees and talk down to them in front of everyone in the office.
The culture is very catty, superficial, and lacks integrity. There's too much favoritism.

pros: Amazing students, educators, core people to work with.
cons: Ever since the Aveda institute in Minneapolis was sold to a different company, I only have poor things to say. Time and time again I've been learning through coursework about how companies should come into a new place to build and satisfy the current employees. Well, Beauty Basics did absolutely nothing. They had a couple meetings at the beginning practically telling us they're guessing what the changes will be "in a year." The changes happened immediately, not "in a year". The only thing Beauty Basics was for sure about, was that every benefit or perk you had while being owned by Estee Lauder was going to be downgraded. BY A LOT. There was amazing instructors and employees who left during this period simply because they had to do what was best for their family. Also because they knew their worth. I would like to add that any salon who is looking to hire students directly out of Aveda institute, lower your standards now. The education system there is changing, and the instructors are leaving.

job_title: Guest Service Coordinator in Minneapolis, MN
pros:
Amazing discounts including super cheap deals on factory test batches
A lot of variety from day to day
Plenty of colleagues to commiserate with
cons:
Absolutely no adherence to corporate mission of sustainability--the amount of paper and other waste in this building is positively terrifying. 
Everything that goes wrong seems to trickle back to being guest service's fault, guest service team lead's response to that is "that's the nature of customer service!" rather than actively changing how different departments interact
A lot of policy seems to come from so far up the corporate chain that it has no basis in how the institute actually runs, and there is nobody on the ground who is empowered to improve things. 
No real opportunity for growth, most departments are small and nobody's going anywhere and you can't get very far in Guest Services or Retail.

pros: for some reason it looks good on a resume.
cons:
long hours, no upward mobility, no reward for hard work, management has no regard for employees or their families, employees are expected to stand ten to twelve hours a day with only a lunch break. you hve a dozen different bosses and they all micromanage. they actualy admit its a cult they joke about "drinking the kool aide" 
I a eraged a 52 hour work week, salary, plus i was expected to drive to St Pete, or Orlando regularly in my days off for team building and classes. i was expected to stay late to fill out sales reports, come in early for meetings every morning and attend all manner of compan functions in my off hours. i once got written up by HR for time off i had recieved permission for from the director and the owner. horrible horrible place.

job_title: Cosmetology Educator/Manager in San Francisco, CA
pros: You have access to advanced education through Aveda and are able to attend classes. Get to be a part of events the school is active in within the Aveda network.
cons: Read the other negative reviews about this place, they are completely true based on my experiences there. The positive reviews are dispassionate and transparent. The owner is the most anxious micromanager I have ever seen. She has no previous experience in education and little passion for delivering industry education herself. She isn't committed to  the Aveda mission personally. She manages with authoritative tones and doesn't even speak to the student body herself! 11 hour shifts were the standard. Teachers were asked to clock in and out- hourly pay. No options for coming in early for prep. Former directors admitted to vomiting in trash can in office due to levels of stress from the owner. Minimum requirements by city/state for benefits package; nothing above and beyond. Don't look for respect in this place, you won't get it.

review_title: Best & Hardest Time of my life!!!
pros: Honestly this was the best employer iv had by far! I looked forward to being their every day and the education I received was phenomenal! I’d go back in a heartbeat!
cons:
This issue with privately owned schools is you have to give in more then I think you should when it comes to students. Rules are rules and shouldn’t ever be bent just because students are not responsible enough to hold themselves to a certain degree... but this goes for all schools in general.

Work work work everyone in the entire school works! It becomes your life and is definitely not for the faint of heart!

pros: You get to make a positive impact on the students lives. They really do adore the good educators who they feel cared about from.
cons: Favoritism, cattiness, educators talking poorly about students instead of wanting to help them, not a "team" environment, no appreciation, no growth, lack of internal structure, students complain regularly about not getting their money's worth for their education. Management and staff will push you out if you express any honest/ unhappy thoughts about the institute. Instead of talking out the issues and coming to a conclusion, the conclusion is that you are a negative person and you probably shouldn't work there.

review_title: No integrity, just in it for the money
pros: None that I am aware of yet.
cons:
Surveillance cameras everywhere watched all day long gets creepy.

Employees speak negatively about each other, students, everyone. The lunchroom is a hot spot for the catty bunch to make fun of others appearance, race, backgrounds, general demeanor. It's sad.
Students and employees alike are under constant attack.

Individuality is not accepted, but rather mocked by staff.

Terrible, awful, ridiculous training.This is so unorganized and you basically have to train yourself. The cosmetology lead who is supposed to train employees can't stay organized or communicate well to save her life. Nobody has been properly trained and this is a problem that should be fixed upstream.

Aveda is supposed to have an environment of wellness and kindness, this institute promotes degradation and hate speech instead. 

Constant lies.

pros: The Aveda brand, and nothing else.
cons: The management team is not qualified to be in their positions. There is nothing luxurious or high end about them. Insecure women who project their negativity on others, very gossipy, and nothing high end about the experience. This institute in Austin gives Aveda a bad name.

review_title: Doesn't get much worse than this
job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: Discounted Aveda products. Talented and determined educators and students. Near BART.
cons: Extremely disorganized company from A to Z., creates a ripple effect that sadly and ultimately perpetuates disgruntled students and burnt out staff. Zero stability.  Rotating door of staff, EXTREMELY high turn over. Consistently out of basic supplies a company needs to function with, let alone a trade school. The culture is the exact opposite of anything Aveda as a company is, the draw for students and potential staff is the reputable name, but it couldn't  be further from Aveda standards. My experience ; I worked with very talented people who would become worn down, tired, confused and misguided by the constant chaos and change. Highly stressful because of mismanagement. Job duties and expectations always changing.

review_title: The negativity and cattiness within the school between employees is awful.  Pay is terrible.
pros: Great place to go to school since it's a world known brand. Prices are great for services. Beautiful location... But again they're better at show than they are anything else.
cons:
Awful place to work. Way too much drama and you lose a sense of individuality. People are fake and gossip about each other like somehow they're exempt from their colleagues talking about them. 

Leads talk about former employees WITH current employees beneath them. This is not just based on personal experience. This is what has been done to multiple employees! I left to separate myself from the drama.

pros: Preparing future cosmetology professionals. Helping to mold students into well equipped and knowledgeable stylists. Working with an amazingly talented group of educators who supported one another.
cons: Worst experience as an educator ever! Management lacks the skills or knowledge as to the field of cosmetology itself. Management was most concerned with utilizing the student population to sell products. Most schools concern themselves with state board pass rates, placement, ensuring students complete the program etc. Aveda could care less, thier motive is product sales second to that is service sales. Management is not concerned with allowing educators and opportunity to voice his/her opinion on ways to improve morale. It's thier way or else you'll have a target on your back. I would not recommend to anyone whom is passionate about education...that is not the primary focus.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros:
Educators, Leads & Director are committed in providing a quality education to students and to set them up for successful career path. 
Administrative office is a fast paced, learning environment, that is changing rapidly & employees have opportunity to grow within the company. 
If you are a self-starter, multitasked & have passion for education, this is a great company to start!

Bonus: retail product discount, complimentary hair & skin care services!
cons: Was hard to leave such a great team of powerful women.

review_title: I've learned so much about myself as a professional; I cannot wait to grow even more.
job_title: Admissions Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great teamwork amongst all teams, committed to giving our students the best possible education and training, committed to making a true impact on the education at the foundation of our Industry, creative artistic folks abound at this company
cons: Turnover is high, Expectations change at a moments notice and not always justifiably, Management can veer toward Micro-Management often, Management not always supportive of individual professional goals and ambitions

review_title: It is a great company, however it went through many changes and merges.  It focuses more on business versus education.
pros: The students are great and the school is beautiful.  Great network in Charlotte and opportunity for growth.  Great platform for community involvement and philanthropy.
cons: Regional management is poor and training can be more organized and effective.  Schedule for students is a bit extreme and proves ineffective.

job_title: Cosmetology Lead Educator in Phoenix, AZ
pros: There is a good amount of autonomy within this position. I have enjoyed traveling and getting to grow and experience working with fashion shows, taking master series courses and teaching new curriculum. There is also a very exciting atmosphere day-to-day and teaching the "future professionals" is very rewarding. The cutting-edge curriculum keeps things fresh.
cons: No 401K. Not the best work/life balance, but the it is not terrible. Existence of department silos can create redundancies.

pros: At Aveda Institute I'm trained by very skilled and professional educators and administators. I have been taught to do various skin treatments for further my career in the field of being an medical Aesthetician such as facials, chemical peels, demonstration of hair removal with lasers using LED lights and waxing procedures. And also how to become a better business asset to esthetician jobs avalible today.
cons: I have no cons. Since I am in training I am so far pleased with everything.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: You learn Great knowledge about hair and skin.
cons: A lot of drama in the workplace, too many employees do not get along and rules can be broken only by those that complain about others that break rules. In other words. Hypocrites.

review_title: Over worked and under paid . The owners lie.
pros: I was able to buy Aveda product for very cheap . Most students were very nice. Getting my hair done all the time.
cons: I watched the owners take financial aid money from there student by making up costs and or fees and telling the students they were short hours and then start charging them over time cost for there hours . They treated the students and employee like trash . It was all about the money not the education at all. There have been turned in to the idaho state licensing board and they are on probation.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Francisco, CA
pros: the students, discount on products (when and if they’re stocked)
cons: Poor management, EXTREME OVER THE TOP micro management, band aid type culture, sneaky and sometimes unethical business practices, owner doesn’t know her own business or how to run things, lies to employees and students, doesn’t have the student or employees best interests at heart, views students as dollar signs instead of people, mental stress and abuse to employees, Instructor exhaustion, constant lawsuits... I could go on, and on, and on...

review_title: The jobs of 3 people, but only getting paid for one!
job_title: Finance Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: Very few knowledgable and friendly workers. Aveda products discounts. Location!
cons:
-Hostile environment! Run by amateurs - with very little knowledge on how to run a school. 
-The owner is all about the money. 
-Very high turnovers, since the day I started. (14+ ongoing...)
-The classrooms, stores, and office are all under surveillance camera. The director and other staff keeps an eye on the monitor to watch employees daily. Basically, their priorities is not straight - instead of creating a better working environment, they create a hostile one. 

-There's no such thing as a JOB DESCRIPTION in this company - your constantly changing your duties on a weekly basis. One day your a finance coordinator, next thing your a financial aid coordinator, then you're doing reports for the salon (whom you're not employed with) then your slaving away in the stock room aka classroom making student kits. FYI- huge heavy boxes to carry, which can hurt your back. They don't provide back support. Students sees you with a questionable face - why are you doing that??? 
-NO TRAINING - everything with Cinta Aveda is "DIY" do it yourself. Every quarter the procedure changes, because employees leave between 0-8 months 
-ERGONOMIC WORKSTATION - NOT ALLOWED! The owner and management will arrange your screen monitor and chair a certain way, which didn't help me work efficiently. In Cinta's own words: " You will get used to it" 
-NO APPRECIATION - don't expect anything
-YOU'RE REPLACEABLE - because they hire anyone
-NO LUNCH BREAKS - with same department - because no one will monitor the telephone to buzz people in the building
-Director and leads are the biggest gossiper. They talk about workers and students all day - especially in the staff breakroom
COMPANY CULTURE - Fake, Catty, and full of DRAMA!

pros: GREAT CULTURE! Great people, and he is very generous to his staff.
cons: Prepare to work hard and prove yourself.

pros: Sells good product lines besides Redken.
cons: In too big of a hurry. The man is rude and doesnt apply color close to root and is sloppy with application. They are not worried about the health of the client s hair.

pros: Love the mission statement that the company represents and the organic ingredients in there products.?
cons: Poor standards for educators from when I️ first started. Not everyone is well rounded or proficient in all aspects of cosmetology

review_title: It's ok, very political, hours totally suck pretty much 8 to 8 wen. Thru sat. Not good if you have a family
pros: Co workers, tests your own knowledge daily,
cons: Not family orientated at all, very rarely is there room to advance within the location

pros: Good education. Quality products. Worked on actual clients.
cons: Only focuses on their products, and the natural approach to esthetics. Would've loved to learn different types of modalities, and how to use equipment in our services. Learning business applications would've been nice also. No help with job placement.

pros: Some of the teachers and students are great
cons: Long hours on your feet, not making enough money, it's all about selling products not teaching students, you work way more hours than they tell you about and you spend most of the day dealing with angry clients. Not a supportive enviroment.

pros: It was wonderful to help students realize their dream of cosmetology! The products are wonderful and it was a beautiful work environment.
cons: The culture is not for everyone. Often times “wellness” is encouraged at face value, but not in terms of work/life balance or daily work schedules.

pros: The students are incredible ,the amount the school interaction with OSU
cons: There is absolutely no comrades among the teaching staff everyone has their own agenda,  and  no unity

pros: No matter where you are coming from as an employee the support you will receive to learn and grow within the industry is so useful for the present and the future.
cons: Long hours, commute, emotionally demanding

pros: Excellent place to work. An amazing atmosphere and great company ethics. Good leadership and training.
cons: Difficult dealing with students at times. Time consuming out of work putting together plans.

pros: HUGE discount on Aveda products, almost 75%
cons: Lack of leadership, lack of communication, lack of support in regards to student issues, clique-y, there's a salary ceiling/ little compensation for extremely hard work.

pros:
- company cares about people 
- products are amazing 
- values of Aveda are taken seriously
- people are friendly and helpful
cons:
- the schedule is challenging - difficult to have small children and work here
- lack of training for educators
